alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 10:09PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN NASH...WILSON AND NORTHEASTERN JOHNSTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM EST... At 1009 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Smithfield, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Wilson, Elm City, Bailey, Micro, Selma, Sharpsburg, Pine Level, Kenly, and Spring Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
